thread.title: Woman in 30s in life-threatening condition after being struck by bus at downtown GO terminal - Toronto - CBC News
thread.title_full: Woman in 30s in life-threatening condition after being struck by bus at downtown GO terminal - Toronto - CBC News

title: Woman in 30s in life-threatening condition after being struck by bus at downtown GO terminal - Toronto - CBC News
text:
Updated Woman in 30s in life-threatening condition after being struck by bus at downtown GO terminal Police say they were called to the Bay Street and Front Street area at around 6:40 p.m. CBC News Posted: Feb 26, 2017 7:22 PM ET Last Updated: Feb 26, 2017 7:33 PM ET Police say they were called to the Bay Street and Front Street area at around 6:40 p.m. for reports that a woman had been hit by a bus. (CBC) 
A woman in her 30s has been rushed to hospital in life-threatening condition after being struck by a bus at the Union GO Transit bus terminal in downtown Toronto. 
Police say they were called to the Bay Street and Front Street area at around 6:40 p.m. for reports that a woman had been hit by a bus. 
It's unknown exactly what type of bus was involved. 
The terminal has been closed and buses are being redirected to other service points, police say. How many passengers are affected is not yet known. 
A number of GO bus routes have been suspended as police investigate. 
#GObus Routes 63, 65 & 71: Union BT closed, pedestrian/bus collision. Use GO Transit fares on TTC to/from Union via Finch Terminal.
